title: CoGenAV: Versatile Audio-Visual Representation Learning via Contrastive-Generative Synchronization
author: Detao Bai (Tongyi Lab, Alibaba Group), Zhiheng Ma (Shenzhen University of Advanced Technology), Xihan Wei (Tongyi Lab, Alibaba Group), Liefeng Bo (Tongyi Lab, Alibaba Group), ...
relevance_why: The contrastive-generative synchronization method for audio-visual representation learning can enhance applications in speech enhancement and audio generation, which are relevant to Dr. Liu's research objectives in audio quality enhancement.
background: This paper focuses on improving audio-visual speech recognition and associated tasks by leveraging the natural synchrony between audio signals and visual cues from lip movements.
contribution: CoGenAV introduces a dual training objective that combines contrastive feature alignment with generative text prediction to enhance audio-visual representation learning, achieving state-of-the-art performance on multiple benchmarks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models usually required extensive datasets or complex training strategies for robust audio-visual representation.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work effectively learns from only 223 hours of data, utilizing a dual objective that captures deeper cross-modal correlations while improving data efficiency.

key_innovation: The combination of contrastive and generative learning strategies to simultaneously align audio-visual features and predict text content is a unique approach that enhances performance and data efficiency.
real_world_impact: By achieving robust performance in challenging noisy environments, this model has practical implications for real-world applications such as hearing aids and automatic transcription services.

new_terms.contrastive-generative synchronization: **Contrastive-generative synchronization** is a training strategy that combines contrastive learning to maximize feature alignment across modalities (audio and visual), with generative learning aimed at predicting accompanying text, benefiting data efficiency and model robustness.

open_sourcing: The model will be open-sourced to encourage further research and collaboration.
